did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY

origination.label: Creator:

persname.normal: Dept. of Floriculture and Ornamental Horticulture, 1908-

origination.persname: Dept. of Floriculture and Ornamental Horticulture 1908-

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This collection features art projects and assignments created in the studio and left behind by students.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Liberty Hyde Bailey established the Department of Drawing in 1908 with William. C. Baker as its first professor. In 1917 the department was dissolved and its work divided between Landscape Art and Rural Engineering. In 1922 Landscape Art became part of the new Department of Floriculture and Ornamental Horticulture.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection features art projects and assignments created in the studio and left behind by students. Mann Library acquired these artworks when Prof. Jack Lambert informed the library the studio was closing due to the renovation of the Mann Library building. Included in the collection are proofs and scratchboards done by former instructors Elizabeth Burckmyer and Ann Elliot. Prof. Burckmyer illustrated “The Makers of Honey,” written by Mary Geisler Phillips, and Ann Elliot designed brochures for various academic departments at Cornell. The collection also contains a portrait of Professor Baker.

did.unittitle: Proofs for "The Makers of Honey" written by Mary Gesiler Phillips; Illustrator-Elizabeth Burckmyer
Brochures designed by Ann Elliot, who taught at Cornell
Portrait of William C. Baker-first professor

Student Works by: Jack Lambert (scientific illustrator), Elizabeth Burckmyer (Director of Freehand Drawing), Ann Elliot, William Baker, and students in the Dept. of Floriculture and Ornamental Horticulture; Landscape Art; Rural Art and Dept. of Drawing
